narrative.title: Deutsches Afrikakorps - 1941Q2
narrative.situation: Deutsches Afrikakorps formed 19 February 1941 as OKW direct command to reinforce Italian forces in North Africa after British Operation Compass victories.
narrative.objectives: Mobile armored spearhead for operations in North Africa - aggressive offensive operations
narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.

supply.notes: Supply situation adequate but strained during Q2 1941 offensive operations. Extended supply lines from Tripoli (800+ km to forward positions). Tobruk siege diverts resources. Port capacity at Benghazi limited.

air_support.note: No theater air summary available for this quarter

special_rules: Combined arms coordination at corps level
Flexible command structure under Rommel's leadership

supply_states.notes: Supply situation adequate but strained during Q2 1941 offensive operations. Extended supply lines from Tripoli (800+ km to forward positions). Tobruk siege diverts resources. Port capacity at Benghazi limited.
